## AppBuilder.state() method

Set the initial application state.

**Signature:**

```typescript
state<S>(initial: S): AppBuilder<S, Components>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

initial


</td><td>

S


</td><td>

The initial state object


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md)<!-- -->&lt;S, Components&gt;

A new [AppBuilder](./dsl.appbuilder.md) with the state type parameter set

## Remarks

This should typically be called early in the builder chain. If called after registering key handlers or a view function, those will be preserved but their type information will be updated to reflect the new state type.

## Example


```typescript
createApp()
  .state({ count: 0, name: 'World' })
```
